info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 16 at 12:45AM CDT until April 16 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT FOR NORTHERN PERRY AND NORTHEASTERN HALE COUNTIES... At 1245 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles southwest of Mertz, or 11 miles northeast of Greensboro, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Marion, Heiberger, Judson College, Radford, Morgan Springs, Sprott, Wateroak, Folsom and Ellards. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
